Hello,

Since the topic no longer exists, (it appears to have been deleted) the notifications must have stopped. Its possible that your mail server was queuing the messages up and delivering them with delay. We should no longer be sending emails to you from the topics arn:aws:sns:us-east-1:659149615316:NotifyMe which I cannot find anymore. 

Please let me know if you are still getting emails. Please also check the timestamps in the mail headers.

Best regards,

Matt J.
Amazon Web Services
We value your feedback. Please rate my response using the link below.
===================================================

Hi,
I had enabled SES notifications to email me when I have bounce issues. This notification has since been spamming my email address, scksystems@kitchenbrains.com with notifications every few minutes. I then disabled the notifications, but it seems to have been stuck. 

When I went into the SNS console, the subscription was marked as deleted but would not delete. I deleted the topic but I am still getting the notification emails. I want to completely remove this SNS subscription as I was only needing the emails for a test, but I can't seem to disable or delete the notifications.

cases.subject: Removed SES notifiyme settings for bounced emails, but SNS subscription was not deleted

Hello there,

This is Enrico from AWS Premium Support, thanks for contacting us,

A quick summary of our chat:

We did the force stop and made the instance available for a new start.
Just in case anyway an AMI have been done before contacting us, great initiative, thanks!

We also waited online to be sure that everything was coming back properly, and we wait for the alarm status to move from "no data" to "OK"

I hope that the information I provided today will prove itself useful. If you have any additional queries or concerns, please do not hesitate to let me know. I'd be happy to help further!

Feel free to mark the case as solved if you prefer, you can always reopen a case if you think it is required. It might be better if you create a new case instead of using the same if you think the history of the case is not relevant for the issue/question you have, this avoids the engineers from going through the case history and in the end he will able to provide a better support.

Best regards,

Enrico B.
Amazon Web Services
We value your feedback. Please rate my response using the link below.
===================================================

03:11:23 PM Enrico: Hello Sir,
03:11:27 PM Enrico: Enrico here from AWS Premium Support
03:11:34 PM Enrico: while I check the case, would you like to tell me your name?
03:11:44 PM rramalingam: Raghavan
03:12:01 PM Enrico: Hello Raghavan
03:12:10 PM Enrico: I see the instance is stuck in stopping right?
03:12:12 PM Enrico:  i-7ec31f15 ?
03:12:35 PM rramalingam: Yes need to force stop it as we have taken an AMI image 
03:12:41 PM Enrico: excellent
03:12:43 PM rramalingam: so no issues in force stop
03:12:52 PM Enrico: I will do it for you ok?
03:13:07 PM rramalingam: Sure go ahead
03:13:25 PM rramalingam: Can't launch the new instance from the AMI as we need the elastic IP released from the current instane
03:13:55 PM Enrico: Just forced stopped
03:14:03 PM Enrico: you should see it in your console
03:14:08 PM Enrico: in maximum 2 minutes normally
03:14:09 PM rramalingam: Yes my console reflects the same
03:14:12 PM Enrico: excellent
03:14:31 PM Enrico: would you need anything else from my side?
03:14:40 PM Enrico: you prefer to wait until you launch the new instance?
03:15:01 PM rramalingam: Instance has been marked for retirement if start it again it should move to new layer right ?
03:15:07 PM Enrico: of course
03:15:21 PM rramalingam: Can you be online I will start the instance
03:15:31 PM Enrico: sure no problem
03:15:45 PM rramalingam: Thanks Will keep you posted once the instance is online
03:16:03 PM Enrico: ok, I profit to take quickly a glass of water
03:16:07 PM Enrico: I will be back in 60 seconds
03:16:46 PM rramalingam: Sure take your time
03:18:39 PM Enrico: here I am
03:20:35 PM rramalingam: instance is reachable via ping few mins will login through SSH for further check
03:21:24 PM Enrico: looks like instance is booting good
03:21:40 PM Enrico: From the console I see
CentOS release 6.5 (Final)
Kernel 3.10.36-1.el6.elrepo.x86_64 on an x86_64

03:22:03 PM Enrico: but weird
03:22:12 PM Enrico: is still the same instance, you did not launch a new one right?
03:22:21 PM Enrico: you are using the old one, did I understand well?
03:22:36 PM Enrico: I mean, the ami was only a "just in case" right?
03:22:53 PM rramalingam: Yes first wanted to move the affected instance and try that if it doesn't pass our internal checks we will launch new one using the AMI taken today
03:22:58 PM Enrico: ok great
03:23:43 PM rramalingam: All is well at the moment except for the Alarm status can you have a look at it
03:24:12 PM Enrico: System 	✔ ok as of 2 minutes ago
Reachability 	✔ passed as of 2 minutes ago 
03:24:12 PM Enrico: Instance 	✔ ok as of 2 minutes ago
Reachability 	✔ passed as of 2 minutes ago 
03:24:18 PM Enrico: do you mean the health checks?
03:24:31 PM rramalingam: Yes
03:24:44 PM Enrico: they looks good, the web console may still have some cached values
03:24:55 PM rramalingam: Alarm status says no data
03:24:55 PM Enrico: let's wait a bit that the cache get invalidated
03:25:00 PM rramalingam: Sure
03:26:41 PM Enrico: bonaccor would like to start an AWS support screen sharing session with you. To do so, please click on the link below and follow the online instructions.

https://screenshare.amazonaws.com/?ak=74d5a7c17b3c809c21bff98607670b97

AWS screen sharing enables a support representative to simultaneously view all of your screens connected to your computer system in order to best assist you with your support inquiry. Session traffic is fully encrypted to protect your system's data. Once a session has begun, you will be able to end it at any time.

-----
Sincerely,
AWS Support
03:26:44 PM Enrico: if you click on the link
03:26:47 PM Enrico: I will see your display
03:26:59 PM Enrico: just to be sure we are talking about the same thing :-)
03:28:07 PM rramalingam: one sec will give screen share
03:29:35 PM Enrico: ok
03:30:09 PM Enrico: Great
03:30:14 PM Enrico: Can I see the alarm you mean?
03:30:30 PM rramalingam: Sure you have the screen
03:30:44 PM Enrico: yes I can see
03:30:48 PM Enrico: a moment
03:34:36 PM Enrico: bye

Hi

When tried to stop instance - i-7ec31f15 console shows stopping and it is stuck in there for ever

Raghavan
Instance ID(s): i-7ec31f15

Hi,

I appreciate your patience on the matter. It seems that actually that Elastic IP is attached to a NAT Gateway nat-02e88bebcd383c66c. Once an EIP is associated with a NAT Gateway, it cannot be disassociated. You will have to delete the NAT Gateway in order to reuse that Elastic IP. You could also allocate a new EIP to use for a replacement NAT Gateway, or associate it with your instance. You could also place your instance behind the NAT Gateway so it would use the same EIP when accessing the Internet.

Please let me know if you have any further issues.

Best regards,

Omar S
Amazon Web Services
We value your feedback. Please rate my response using the link below.
===================================================

This is our production data server. We need to have daily backups. Due to this we couldn't take any backups into our S3 and our SLA is getting breached. Can you take this item as mentioned severity as urgent and address it ASAP ?

Thanks.

Hi Gubs,

I've let the Networking team know about the issue. Hopefully they'll be in touch soon and when they have an update I'll let you know. In the meantime, if you have any further questions or concerns, please let me know and I'll be happy to help.

Best regards,

Omar S

Hello Nick!

It was a pleasure speaking with you today!
 
Per our conversation, I did leave a voice mail so if you locate that feel free to disregard the remainder of this email and submit your MFA request again. We will call you back in 15 minutes to assist with removing the MFA!

If you do not locate the voice mail I left, in order to proceed with your request to remove the MFA token from the account, please provide us with the following documents, in English:

1) A completed, signed, and notarized Identity Verification Form and Affidavit, which can be downloaded online at the following link:

https://s3.amazonaws.com/AWSCS_CustomerForms/IdentityVerificationFormAffidavit.doc

2) A photocopy of the AWS account owner’s primary proof of identification.

3) A photocopy of the AWS account owner’s proof of address matching the address on file.

Carefully review the following requirements for these photocopies so that we can complete our investigations as soon as possible.

https://s3.amazonaws.com/AWSCS_CustomerForms/Required_Documentation_for_MFA_Removal.pdf

Please scan all forms and photocopies and attach them as digital files to your email response to aws@amazon.com. All personal information not related to the account should be redacted, such as social security numbers and bank accounts.

If you have any questions, please contact us by responding directly to this email, and we'll get back to you as soon as possible.
Have a great day!

Best regards,

Rachael H.
Amazon Web Services
We value your feedback. Please rate my response using the link below.
===================================================

Hello Nick,

Thank you for your time on call today. You had issues with the root account being locked since it was assigned to an old employee.

The steps to resolve this would be:

1) Click the forgot my password for the root account and we would send a link to reset it to the email registered: itsupport@kitchenbrains.com 

However, in your case this root account also has MFA enabled so even if you reset the password and use the new one, the next screen will prompt for the MFA token code which I assume you do not have.

So the best solution for you would be step two:

What If an MFA Device Is Lost or Stops Working? Please refer to:

[+] http://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_credentials_mfa_lost-or-broken.html

Once you get this done you can change the root credentials anytime using the steps in link below (there are edit options for name and email address too):

[+] http://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_credentials_passwords_change-root.html

Hope this was helpful. Please do let me know if you have any further questions regarding this. I would be happy to assist you.

Best regards,

SREENATH D.
Amazon Web Services
We value your feedback. Please rate my response using the link below.
===================================================

Thanks,
Gubendran

Hello Gubs, 

Thank you for contacting AWS Support. 

I understand that you were receiving errors when you were trying to connect to the RDS instance using MicroStrategy ODBC. Access denied for the user using password no possible not the error related to the permissions. Have you tried to reset the master user password to connect to the instance again? I do not see any action taken from Amazon to resolve the issue, it should have been some change from your end.

To reset the master user password your RDS account, login into your RDS account. Select the instance that you want to modify and click the drop-down menu bar that says 'Instance Actions' and in that drop-down list click 'Modify'. On the next page you would set the password under the Settings 'New Master Password' and select the 'Apply Immediately' check-box and click Continue.
[+]http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/USER_ModifyInstance.MySQL.html

As RDS is a managed service, you would not be able to Grant all privileges on all the databases and that is the reason why you received the 'Error Code: 1045 Access denied for user 'msdataadmin'@'%' (using password: YES)'. The documentation below lists all the privileges that are assigned to default master user in Maria DB Instance. 
[+]http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/UsingWithRDS.MasterAccounts.html

The default master user 'msdataadmin' for 'msmetadata' DB instance should have the privileges you mentioned in the correspondence that are required for the user. If you are unable to create to trigger/any other issues with the database, to troubleshoot the issue further please provide the following information:

Connect to the DB instance and run the following commands:
mysql> select user, host from mysql.user;
mysql> show grants for msdataadmin\G

Also, you would be able to create a user that has same privileges as your current master user: 

mysql> CREATE USER 'mynewuser'@'%' IDENTIFIED BY 'password'; 

mysql> GRANT SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, CREATE, DROP, RELOAD, PROCESS, REFERENCES, INDEX, ALTER, SHOW DATABASES, CREATE TEMPORARY TABLES, LOCK TABLES, EXECUTE, REPLICATION SLAVE, REPLICATION CLIENT, CREATE VIEW, SHOW VIEW, CREATE ROUTINE, ALTER ROUTINE, CREATE USER, EVENT, TRIGGER ON *.* TO 'mynewuser'@'%' WITH GRANT OPTION;

mysql> flush privileges;

I will look forward for you response.

Best regards,

Meenakshi T.
Amazon Web Services
We value your feedback. Please rate my response using the link below.
===================================================

Currently, ODBC has connectivity to the mariaDB. I am not sure if someone from amazon worked on it. But, We don't have create permission for trigger for the user "msdataadmin" for the db "msmetadata". We need below permission for the user. Can you please provide ?

Database Object Type of Permissions Required
Tables Select, Insert, Update, Create, Drop, Delete
Indexes Create, Drop
Triggers Create, Drop
Functions Create, Execute
Packages Create
Procedures Create, Execute

Hi Amazon Team,

I have MariaDB RDS instance in AWS (N.Virgina), dbName : msmetadata. I was trying to connect into this RDS instance using MySQL client or jdbc using "mysql -u<username> -p<pwd> -h<public-hostname|public-ip>" it works. 

Same way when i was trying to connect to RDS instance using MicroStrategy ODBC it fails with access denied. 
"Access denied for user 'msdataadmin'@'10.0.20.7' (using password: NO)". 

If i try to give grant permission from my user for 10.0.20.7 ip i am getting again below error.
GRANT ALL ON *.* TO 'msdataadmin'@'10.0.20.7' IDENTIFIED BY 'pwd';
FLUSH PRIVILEGES;

Error Code: 1045
Access denied for user 'msdataadmin'@'%' (using password: YES)

Do you have any idea whats going on ? We use MySQL 5.3.6 unicode driver for ODBC.

Thanks,
Gubs

cases.subject: Access denied for user issue entering into RDS MariaDB instance

Hi Gubs,

Thank you for contacting AWS Premium Support. My name is Ben and I will be happy to assist you today. I understand that you want to add an A record into the domain "mysck.net" for your ELB "mswselbexternal-1898365471.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com".

In compliance with security best practices, AWS engineers do not have the ability to update your records or work with your resources. However, I will be more than happy to guide you on updating the record in Route53.

First, taking a look at your Route53 resources, I do not see any Hosted Zones under this account. If you have another account that uses this domain, please do create a ticket on that account for the best possible assistance. If you want to create the record on this account, then please do the following steps below.

1) Go to the Route53 Hosted Zone at: https://console.aws.amazon.com/route53

2) Select "Get Started Now" under DNS Management, and choose "Create Hosted Zone"

3) In the Create Hosted Zone pane, enter "mysck.net" and click "Create"

4) Choose the hosted zone you just created on the "Hosted Zones" page and click "Create Record Set".

5) In the right panel, select "Yes" for Alias and in the box that next to Alias Target, look for the ELB "mswselbexternal-1898365471.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com" and hit "Save Record Set". Please note, you can change the routing policy or set up health evaluation as you need.

This public doc goes over creating record sets in details:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/Route53/latest/DeveloperGuide/resource-record-sets-creating.html

Performing the command "whois msck.net", I also see that the domain belongs to the third-party registrar "NETWORK SOLUTIONS, LLC.".

You will want to make sure that the name servers are propagating to the name servers in Route53, which are of type "NS". This has to be done at the domain provider's website.

This is the third-party documentation for Network Solutions:
http://www.networksolutions.com/support/move-dns-to-a-new-server/

Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns.

Best regards,

Ben
Amazon Web Services
We value your feedback. Please rate my response using the link below.
===================================================

Hi Amazon Team,

Can you please add the new DNS Name "mswselbexternal-1898365471.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com (A Record)" into mysck.net record ?

Thanks,
Gubs

cases.subject: Add our new DNS Name into record
